verses.name: Proverbs 1:1
verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:2
verses.text: for attaining wisdom and discipline; for understanding words of insight;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:3
verses.text: for acquiring a disciplined and prudent life, doing what is right and just and fair;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:4
verses.text: for giving prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the young-

verses.name: Proverbs 1:5
verses.text: let the wise listen and add to their learning, and let the discerning get guidance-

verses.name: Proverbs 1:6
verses.text: for understanding proverbs and parables, the sayings and riddles of the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:7
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:8
verses.text: Listen, my son, to your father's instruction and do not forsake your mother's teaching.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:9
verses.text: They will be a garland to grace your head and a chain to adorn your neck.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:10
verses.text: My son, if sinners entice you, do not give in to them.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:11
verses.text: If they say, "Come along with us; let's lie in wait for someone's blood, let's waylay some harmless soul;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:12
verses.text: let's swallow them alive, like the grave, and whole, like those who go down to the pit;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:13
verses.text: we will get all sorts of valuable things and fill our houses with plunder;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:14
verses.text: throw in your lot with us, and we will share a common purse"-

verses.name: Proverbs 1:15
verses.text: my son, do not go along with them, do not set foot on their paths;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:16
verses.text: for their feet rush into sin, they are swift to shed blood.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:17
verses.text: How useless to spread a net in full view of all the birds!

verses.name: Proverbs 1:18
verses.text: These men lie in wait for their own blood; they waylay only themselves!

verses.name: Proverbs 1:19
verses.text: Such is the end of all who go after ill-gotten gain; it takes away the lives of those who get it.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:20
verses.text: Wisdom calls aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the public squares;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:21
verses.text: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out, in the gateways of the city she makes her speech:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:22
verses.text: "How long will you simple ones love your simple ways? How long will mockers delight in mockery and fools hate knowledge?

verses.name: Proverbs 1:23
verses.text: If you had responded to my rebuke, I would have poured out my heart to you and made my thoughts known to you.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:24
verses.text: But since you rejected me when I called and no one gave heed when I stretched out my hand,

verses.name: Proverbs 1:25
verses.text: since you ignored all my advice and would not accept my rebuke,

verses.name: Proverbs 1:26
verses.text: I in turn will laugh at your disaster; I will mock when calamity overtakes you-

verses.name: Proverbs 1:27
verses.text: when calamity overtakes you like a storm, when disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind, when distress and trouble overwhelm you.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:28
verses.text: "Then they will call to me but I will not answer; they will look for me but will not find me.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:29
verses.text: Since they hated knowledge and did not choose to fear the LORD,

verses.name: Proverbs 1:30
verses.text: since they would not accept my advice and spurned my rebuke,

verses.name: Proverbs 1:31
verses.text: they will eat the fruit of their ways and be filled with the fruit of their schemes.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:32
verses.text: For the waywardness of the simple will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:33
verses.text: but whoever listens to me will live in safety and be at ease, without fear of harm."

verses.name: Proverbs 2:1
verses.text: My son, if you accept my words and store up my commands within you,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:2
verses.text: turning your ear to wisdom and applying your heart to understanding,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:3
verses.text: and if you call out for insight and cry aloud for understanding,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:4
verses.text: and if you look for it as for silver and search for it as for hidden treasure,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:5
verses.text: then you will understand the fear of the LORD and find the knowledge of God.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:6
verses.text: For the LORD gives wisdom, and from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:7
verses.text: He holds victory in store for the upright, he is a shield to those whose walk is blameless,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:8
verses.text: for he guards the course of the just and protects the way of his faithful ones.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:9
verses.text: Then you will understand what is right and just and fair-every good path.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:10
verses.text: For wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:11
verses.text: Discretion will protect you, and understanding will guard you.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:12
verses.text: Wisdom will save you from the ways of wicked men, from men whose words are perverse,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:13
verses.text: who leave the straight paths to walk in dark ways,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:14
verses.text: who delight in doing wrong and rejoice in the perverseness of evil,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:15
verses.text: whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their ways.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:16
verses.text: It will save you also from the adulteress, from the wayward wife with her seductive words,

verses.name: Proverbs 2:17
verses.text: who has left the partner of her youth and ignored the covenant she made before God.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:18
verses.text: For her house leads down to death and her paths to the spirits of the dead.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:19
verses.text: None who go to her return or attain the paths of life.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:20
verses.text: Thus you will walk in the ways of good men and keep to the paths of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 2:21
verses.text: For the upright will live in the land, and the blameless will remain in it;

verses.name: Proverbs 2:22
verses.text: but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful will be torn from it.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:1
verses.text: My son, do not forget my teaching, but keep my commands in your heart,

verses.name: Proverbs 3:2
verses.text: for they will prolong your life many years and bring you prosperity.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:3
verses.text: Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:4
verses.text: Then you will win favor and a good name in the sight of God and man.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:5
verses.text: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding;

verses.name: Proverbs 3:6
verses.text: in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:7
verses.text: Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and shun evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:8
verses.text: This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:9
verses.text: Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops;

verses.name: Proverbs 3:10
verses.text: then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:11
verses.text: My son, do not despise the LORD's discipline and do not resent his rebuke,

verses.name: Proverbs 3:12
verses.text: because the LORD disciplines those he loves, as a father the son he delights in.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:13
verses.text: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gains understanding,

verses.name: Proverbs 3:14
verses.text: for she is more profitable than silver and yields better returns than gold.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:15
verses.text: She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:16
verses.text: Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:17
verses.text: Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peace.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:18
verses.text: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her; those who lay hold of her will be blessed.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:19
verses.text: By wisdom the LORD laid the earth's foundations, by understanding he set the heavens in place;

verses.name: Proverbs 3:20
verses.text: by his knowledge the deeps were divided, and the clouds let drop the dew.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:21
verses.text: My son, preserve sound judgment and discernment, do not let them out of your sight;

verses.name: Proverbs 3:22
verses.text: they will be life for you, an ornament to grace your neck.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:23
verses.text: Then you will go on your way in safety, and your foot will not stumble;

verses.name: Proverbs 3:24
verses.text: when you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:25
verses.text: Have no fear of sudden disaster or of the ruin that overtakes the wicked,

verses.name: Proverbs 3:26
verses.text: for the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being snared.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:27
verses.text: Do not withhold good from those who deserve it, when it is in your power to act.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:28
verses.text: Do not say to your neighbor, "Come back later; I'll give it tomorrow"- when you now have it with you.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:29
verses.text: Do not plot harm against your neighbor, who lives trustfully near you.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:30
verses.text: Do not accuse a man for no reason- when he has done you no harm.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:31
verses.text: Do not envy a violent man or choose any of his ways,

verses.name: Proverbs 3:32
verses.text: for the LORD detests a perverse man but takes the upright into his confidence.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:33
verses.text: The LORD's curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the home of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:34
verses.text: He mocks proud mockers but gives grace to the humble.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:35
verses.text: The wise inherit honor, but fools he holds up to shame.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:1
verses.text: Listen, my sons, to a father's instruction; pay attention and gain understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:2
verses.text: I give you sound learning, so do not forsake my teaching.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:3
verses.text: When I was a boy in my father's house, still tender, and an only child of my mother,

verses.name: Proverbs 4:4
verses.text: he taught me and said, "Lay hold of my words with all your heart; keep my commands and you will live.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:5
verses.text: Get wisdom, get understanding; do not forget my words or swerve from them.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:6
verses.text: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you; love her, and she will watch over you.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:7
verses.text: Wisdom is supreme; therefore get wisdom. Though it cost all you have, get understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:8
verses.text: Esteem her, and she will exalt you; embrace her, and she will honor you.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:9
verses.text: She will set a garland of grace on your head and present you with a crown of splendor."

verses.name: Proverbs 4:10
verses.text: Listen, my son, accept what I say, and the years of your life will be many.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:11
verses.text: I guide you in the way of wisdom and lead you along straight paths.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:12
verses.text: When you walk, your steps will not be hampered; when you run, you will not stumble.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:13
verses.text: Hold on to instruction, do not let it go; guard it well, for it is your life.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:14
verses.text: Do not set foot on the path of the wicked or walk in the way of evil men.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:15
verses.text: Avoid it, do not travel on it; turn from it and go on your way.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:16
verses.text: For they cannot sleep till they do evil; they are robbed of slumber till they make someone fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:17
verses.text: They eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:18
verses.text: The path of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, shining ever brighter till the full light of day.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:19
verses.text: But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know what makes them stumble.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:20
verses.text: My son, pay attention to what I say; listen closely to my words.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:21
verses.text: Do not let them out of your sight, keep them within your heart;

verses.name: Proverbs 4:22
verses.text: for they are life to those who find them and health to a man's whole body.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:23
verses.text: Above all else, guard your heart, for it is the wellspring of life.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:24
verses.text: Put away perversity from your mouth; keep corrupt talk far from your lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:25
verses.text: Let your eyes look straight ahead, fix your gaze directly before you.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:26
verses.text: Make level paths for your feet and take only ways that are firm.

verses.name: Proverbs 4:27
verses.text: Do not swerve to the right or the left; keep your foot from evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:1
verses.text: My son, pay attention to my wisdom, listen well to my words of insight,

verses.name: Proverbs 5:2
verses.text: that you may maintain discretion and your lips may preserve knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:3
verses.text: For the lips of an adulteress drip honey, and her speech is smoother than oil;

verses.name: Proverbs 5:4
verses.text: but in the end she is bitter as gall, sharp as a double-edged sword.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:5
verses.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead straight to the grave.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:6
verses.text: She gives no thought to the way of life; her paths are crooked, but she knows it not.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:7
verses.text: Now then, my sons, listen to me; do not turn aside from what I say.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:8
verses.text: Keep to a path far from her, do not go near the door of her house,

verses.name: Proverbs 5:9
verses.text: lest you give your best strength to others and your years to one who is cruel,

verses.name: Proverbs 5:10
verses.text: lest strangers feast on your wealth and your toil enrich another man's house.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:11
verses.text: At the end of your life you will groan, when your flesh and body are spent.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:12
verses.text: You will say, "How I hated discipline! How my heart spurned correction!

verses.name: Proverbs 5:13
verses.text: I would not obey my teachers or listen to my instructors.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:14
verses.text: I have come to the brink of utter ruin in the midst of the whole assembly."

verses.name: Proverbs 5:15
verses.text: Drink water from your own cistern, running water from your own well.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:16
verses.text: Should your springs overflow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares?

verses.name: Proverbs 5:17
verses.text: Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:18
verses.text: May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:19
verses.text: A loving doe, a graceful deer- may her breasts satisfy you always, may you ever be captivated by her love.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:20
verses.text: Why be captivated, my son, by an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another man's wife?

verses.name: Proverbs 5:21
verses.text: For a man's ways are in full view of the LORD, and he examines all his paths.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:22
verses.text: The evil deeds of a wicked man ensnare him; the cords of his sin hold him fast.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:23
verses.text: He will die for lack of discipline, led astray by his own great folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:1
verses.text: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, if you have struck hands in pledge for another,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:2
verses.text: if you have been trapped by what you said, ensnared by the words of your mouth,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:3
verses.text: then do this, my son, to free yourself, since you have fallen into your neighbor's hands: Go and humble yourself; press your plea with your neighbor!

verses.name: Proverbs 6:4
verses.text: Allow no sleep to your eyes, no slumber to your eyelids.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:5
verses.text: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:6
verses.text: Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise!

verses.name: Proverbs 6:7
verses.text: It has no commander, no overseer or ruler,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:8
verses.text: yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:9
verses.text: How long will you lie there, you sluggard? When will you get up from your sleep?

verses.name: Proverbs 6:10
verses.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest-

verses.name: Proverbs 6:11
verses.text: and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:12
verses.text: A scoundrel and villain, who goes about with a corrupt mouth,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:13
verses.text: who winks with his eye, signals with his feet and motions with his fingers,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:14
verses.text: who plots evil with deceit in his heart- he always stirs up dissension.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:15
verses.text: Therefore disaster will overtake him in an instant; he will suddenly be destroyed-without remedy.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:16
verses.text: There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him:

verses.name: Proverbs 6:17
verses.text: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:18
verses.text: a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into evil,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:19
verses.text: a false witness who pours out lies and a man who stirs up dissension among brothers.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:20
verses.text: My son, keep your father's commands and do not forsake your mother's teaching.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:21
verses.text: Bind them upon your heart forever; fasten them around your neck.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:22
verses.text: When you walk, they will guide you; when you sleep, they will watch over you; when you awake, they will speak to you.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:23
verses.text: For these commands are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the corrections of discipline are the way to life,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:24
verses.text: keeping you from the immoral woman, from the smooth tongue of the wayward wife.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:25
verses.text: Do not lust in your heart after her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyes,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:26
verses.text: for the prostitute reduces you to a loaf of bread, and the adulteress preys upon your very life.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:27
verses.text: Can a man scoop fire into his lap without his clothes being burned?

verses.name: Proverbs 6:28
verses.text: Can a man walk on hot coals without his feet being scorched?

verses.name: Proverbs 6:29
verses.text: So is he who sleeps with another man's wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:30
verses.text: Men do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his hunger when he is starving.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:31
verses.text: Yet if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold, though it costs him all the wealth of his house.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:32
verses.text: But a man who commits adultery lacks judgment; whoever does so destroys himself.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:33
verses.text: Blows and disgrace are his lot, and his shame will never be wiped away;

verses.name: Proverbs 6:34
verses.text: for jealousy arouses a husband's fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:35
verses.text: He will not accept any compensation; he will refuse the bribe, however great it is.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:1
verses.text: My son, keep my words and store up my commands within you.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:2
verses.text: Keep my commands and you will live; guard my teachings as the apple of your eye.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:3
verses.text: Bind them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:4
verses.text: Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and call understanding your kinsman;

verses.name: Proverbs 7:5
verses.text: they will keep you from the adulteress, from the wayward wife with her seductive words.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:6
verses.text: At the window of my house I looked out through the lattice.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:7
verses.text: I saw among the simple, I noticed among the young men, a youth who lacked judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:8
verses.text: He was going down the street near her corner, walking along in the direction of her house

verses.name: Proverbs 7:9
verses.text: at twilight, as the day was fading, as the dark of night set in.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:10
verses.text: Then out came a woman to meet him, dressed like a prostitute and with crafty intent.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:11
verses.text: (She is loud and defiant, her feet never stay at home;

verses.name: Proverbs 7:12
verses.text: now in the street, now in the squares, at every corner she lurks.)

verses.name: Proverbs 7:13
verses.text: She took hold of him and kissed him and with a brazen face she said:

verses.name: Proverbs 7:14
verses.text: "I have fellowship offerings at home; today I fulfilled my vows.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:15
verses.text: So I came out to meet you; I looked for you and have found you!

verses.name: Proverbs 7:16
verses.text: I have covered my bed with colored linens from Egypt.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:17
verses.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:18
verses.text: Come, let's drink deep of love till morning; let's enjoy ourselves with love!

verses.name: Proverbs 7:19
verses.text: My husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:20
verses.text: He took his purse filled with money and will not be home till full moon."

verses.name: Proverbs 7:21
verses.text: With persuasive words she led him astray; she seduced him with her smooth talk.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:22
verses.text: All at once he followed her like an ox going to the slaughter, like a deer stepping into a noose

verses.name: Proverbs 7:23
verses.text: till an arrow pierces his liver, like a bird darting into a snare, little knowing it will cost him his life.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:24
verses.text: Now then, my sons, listen to me; pay attention to what I say.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:25
verses.text: Do not let your heart turn to her ways or stray into her paths.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:26
verses.text: Many are the victims she has brought down; her slain are a mighty throng.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:27
verses.text: Her house is a highway to the grave, leading down to the chambers of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:1
verses.text: Does not wisdom call out? Does not understanding raise her voice?

verses.name: Proverbs 8:2
verses.text: On the heights along the way, where the paths meet, she takes her stand;

verses.name: Proverbs 8:3
verses.text: beside the gates leading into the city, at the entrances, she cries aloud:

verses.name: Proverbs 8:4
verses.text: "To you, O men, I call out; I raise my voice to all mankind.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:5
verses.text: You who are simple, gain prudence; you who are foolish, gain understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:6
verses.text: Listen, for I have worthy things to say; I open my lips to speak what is right.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:7
verses.text: My mouth speaks what is true, for my lips detest wickedness.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:8
verses.text: All the words of my mouth are just; none of them is crooked or perverse.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:9
verses.text: To the discerning all of them are right; they are faultless to those who have knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:10
verses.text: Choose my instruction instead of silver, knowledge rather than choice gold,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:11
verses.text: for wisdom is more precious than rubies, and nothing you desire can compare with her.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:12
verses.text: "I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence; I possess knowledge and discretion.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:13
verses.text: To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate pride and arrogance, evil behavior and perverse speech.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:14
verses.text: Counsel and sound judgment are mine; I have understanding and power.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:15
verses.text: By me kings reign and rulers make laws that are just;

verses.name: Proverbs 8:16
verses.text: by me princes govern, and all nobles who rule on earth.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:17
verses.text: I love those who love me, and those who seek me find me.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:18
verses.text: With me are riches and honor, enduring wealth and prosperity.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:19
verses.text: My fruit is better than fine gold; what I yield surpasses choice silver.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:20
verses.text: I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:21
verses.text: bestowing wealth on those who love me and making their treasuries full.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:22
verses.text: "The LORD brought me forth as the first of his works,, before his deeds of old;

verses.name: Proverbs 8:23
verses.text: I was appointed from eternity, from the beginning, before the world began.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:24
verses.text: When there were no oceans, I was given birth, when there were no springs abounding with water;

verses.name: Proverbs 8:25
verses.text: before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was given birth,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:26
verses.text: before he made the earth or its fields or any of the dust of the world.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:27
verses.text: I was there when he set the heavens in place, when he marked out the horizon on the face of the deep,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:28
verses.text: when he established the clouds above and fixed securely the fountains of the deep,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:29
verses.text: when he gave the sea its boundary so the waters would not overstep his command, and when he marked out the foundations of the earth.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:30
verses.text: Then I was the craftsman at his side. I was filled with delight day after day, rejoicing always in his presence,

verses.name: Proverbs 8:31
verses.text: rejoicing in his whole world and delighting in mankind.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:32
verses.text: "Now then, my sons, listen to me; blessed are those who keep my ways.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:33
verses.text: Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not ignore it.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:34
verses.text: Blessed is the man who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:35
verses.text: For whoever finds me finds life and receives favor from the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 8:36
verses.text: But whoever fails to find me harms himself; all who hate me love death."

verses.name: Proverbs 9:1
verses.text: Wisdom has built her house; she has hewn out its seven pillars.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:2
verses.text: She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine; she has also set her table.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:3
verses.text: She has sent out her maids, and she calls from the highest point of the city.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:4
verses.text: "Let all who are simple come in here!" she says to those who lack judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:5
verses.text: "Come, eat my food and drink the wine I have mixed.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:6
verses.text: Leave your simple ways and you will live; walk in the way of understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:7
verses.text: "Whoever corrects a mocker invites insult; whoever rebukes a wicked man incurs abuse.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:8
verses.text: Do not rebuke a mocker or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man and he will love you.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:9
verses.text: Instruct a wise man and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man and he will add to his learning.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:10
verses.text: "The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:11
verses.text: For through me your days will be many, and years will be added to your life.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:12
verses.text: If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you; if you are a mocker, you alone will suffer."

verses.name: Proverbs 9:13
verses.text: The woman Folly is loud; she is undisciplined and without knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:14
verses.text: She sits at the door of her house, on a seat at the highest point of the city,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:15
verses.text: calling out to those who pass by, who go straight on their way.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:16
verses.text: "Let all who are simple come in here!" she says to those who lack judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:17
verses.text: "Stolen water is sweet; food eaten in secret is delicious!"

verses.name: Proverbs 9:18
verses.text: But little do they know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of the grave.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:1
verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grief to his mother.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:2
verses.text: Ill-gotten treasures are of no value, but righteousness delivers from death.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:3
verses.text: The LORD does not let the righteous go hungry but he thwarts the craving of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:4
verses.text: Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:5
verses.text: He who gathers crops in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:6
verses.text: Blessings crown the head of the righteous, but violence overwhelms the mouth of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:7
verses.text: The memory of the righteous will be a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:8
verses.text: The wise in heart accept commands, but a chattering fool comes to ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:9
verses.text: The man of integrity walks securely, but he who takes crooked paths will be found out.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:10
verses.text: He who winks maliciously causes grief, and a chattering fool comes to ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:11
verses.text: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but violence overwhelms the mouth of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:12
verses.text: Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers over all wrongs.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:13
verses.text: Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of him who lacks judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:14
verses.text: Wise men store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool invites ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:15
verses.text: The wealth of the rich is their fortified city, but poverty is the ruin of the poor.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:16
verses.text: The wages of the righteous bring them life, but the income of the wicked brings them punishment.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:17
verses.text: He who heeds discipline shows the way to life, but whoever ignores correction leads others astray.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:18
verses.text: He who conceals his hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:19
verses.text: When words are many, sin is not absent, but he who holds his tongue is wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:20
verses.text: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked is of little value.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:21
verses.text: The lips of the righteous nourish many, but fools die for lack of judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:22
verses.text: The blessing of the LORD brings wealth, and he adds no trouble to it.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:23
verses.text: A fool finds pleasure in evil conduct, but a man of understanding delights in wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:24
verses.text: What the wicked dreads will overtake him; what the righteous desire will be granted.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:25
verses.text: When the storm has swept by, the wicked are gone, but the righteous stand firm forever.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:26
verses.text: As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is a sluggard to those who send him.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:27
verses.text: The fear of the LORD adds length to life, but the years of the wicked are cut short.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:28
verses.text: The prospect of the righteous is joy, but the hopes of the wicked come to nothing.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:29
verses.text: The way of the LORD is a refuge for the righteous, but it is the ruin of those who do evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:30
verses.text: The righteous will never be uprooted, but the wicked will not remain in the land.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:31
verses.text: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but a perverse tongue will be cut out.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:32
verses.text: The lips of the righteous know what is fitting, but the mouth of the wicked only what is perverse.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:1
verses.text: The LORD abhors dishonest scales, but accurate weights are his delight.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:2
verses.text: When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:3
verses.text: The integrity of the upright guides them, but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:4
verses.text: Wealth is worthless in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:5
verses.text: The righteousness of the blameless makes a straight way for them, but the wicked are brought down by their own wickedness.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:6
verses.text: The righteousness of the upright delivers them, but the unfaithful are trapped by evil desires.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:7
verses.text: When a wicked man dies, his hope perishes; all he expected from his power comes to nothing.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:8
verses.text: The righteous man is rescued from trouble, and it comes on the wicked instead.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:9
verses.text: With his mouth the godless destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous escape.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:10
verses.text: When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:11
verses.text: Through the blessing of the upright a city is exalted, but by the mouth of the wicked it is destroyed.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:12
verses.text: A man who lacks judgment derides his neighbor, but a man of understanding holds his tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:13
verses.text: A gossip betrays a confidence, but a trustworthy man keeps a secret.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:14
verses.text: For lack of guidance a nation falls, but many advisers make victory sure.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:15
verses.text: He who puts up security for another will surely suffer, but whoever refuses to strike hands in pledge is safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:16
verses.text: A kindhearted woman gains respect, but ruthless men gain only wealth.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:17
verses.text: A kind man benefits himself, but a cruel man brings trouble on himself.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:18
verses.text: The wicked man earns deceptive wages, but he who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:19
verses.text: The truly righteous man attains life, but he who pursues evil goes to his death.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:20
verses.text: The LORD detests men of perverse heart but he delights in those whose ways are blameless.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:21
verses.text: Be sure of this: The wicked will not go unpunished, but those who are righteous will go free.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:22
verses.text: Like a gold ring in a pig's snout is a beautiful woman who shows no discretion.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:23
verses.text: The desire of the righteous ends only in good, but the hope of the wicked only in wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:24
verses.text: One man gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds unduly, but comes to poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:25
verses.text: A generous man will prosper; he who refreshes others will himself be refreshed.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:26
verses.text: People curse the man who hoards grain, but blessing crowns him who is willing to sell.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:27
verses.text: He who seeks good finds goodwill, but evil comes to him who searches for it.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:28
verses.text: Whoever trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous will thrive like a green leaf.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:29
verses.text: He who brings trouble on his family will inherit only wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:30
verses.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 11:31
verses.text: If the righteous receive their due on earth, how much more the ungodly and the sinner!

verses.name: Proverbs 12:1
verses.text: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates correction is stupid.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:2
verses.text: A good man obtains favor from the LORD, but the LORD condemns a crafty man.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:3
verses.text: A man cannot be established through wickedness, but the righteous cannot be uprooted.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:4
verses.text: A wife of noble character is her husband's crown, but a disgraceful wife is like decay in his bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:5
verses.text: The plans of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:6
verses.text: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:7
verses.text: Wicked men are overthrown and are no more, but the house of the righteous stands firm.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:8
verses.text: A man is praised according to his wisdom, but men with warped minds are despised.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:9
verses.text: Better to be a nobody and yet have a servant than pretend to be somebody and have no food.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:10
verses.text: A righteous man cares for the needs of his animal, but the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:11
verses.text: He who works his land will have abundant food, but he who chases fantasies lacks judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:12
verses.text: The wicked desire the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:13
verses.text: An evil man is trapped by his sinful talk, but a righteous man escapes trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:14
verses.text: From the fruit of his lips a man is filled with good things as surely as the work of his hands rewards him.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:15
verses.text: The way of a fool seems right to him, but a wise man listens to advice.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:16
verses.text: A fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:17
verses.text: A truthful witness gives honest testimony, but a false witness tells lies.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:18
verses.text: Reckless words pierce like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:19
verses.text: Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:20
verses.text: There is deceit in the hearts of those who plot evil, but joy for those who promote peace.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:21
verses.text: No harm befalls the righteous, but the wicked have their fill of trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:22
verses.text: The LORD detests lying lips, but he delights in men who are truthful.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:23
verses.text: A prudent man keeps his knowledge to himself, but the heart of fools blurts out folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:24
verses.text: Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:25
verses.text: An anxious heart weighs a man down, but a kind word cheers him up.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:26
verses.text: A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:27
verses.text: The lazy man does not roast his game, but the diligent man prizes his possessions.

verses.name: Proverbs 12:28
verses.text: In the way of righteousness there is life; along that path is immortality.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:1
verses.text: A wise son heeds his father's instruction, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:2
verses.text: From the fruit of his lips a man enjoys good things, but the unfaithful have a craving for violence.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:3
verses.text: He who guards his lips guards his life, but he who speaks rashly will come to ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:4
verses.text: The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:5
verses.text: The righteous hate what is false, but the wicked bring shame and disgrace.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:6
verses.text: Righteousness guards the man of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:7
verses.text: One man pretends to be rich, yet has nothing; another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:8
verses.text: A man's riches may ransom his life, but a poor man hears no threat.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:9
verses.text: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:10
verses.text: Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is found in those who take advice.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:11
verses.text: Dishonest money dwindles away, but he who gathers money little by little makes it grow.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:12
verses.text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:13
verses.text: He who scorns instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command is rewarded.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:14
verses.text: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:15
verses.text: Good understanding wins favor, but the way of the unfaithful is hard.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:16
verses.text: Every prudent man acts out of knowledge, but a fool exposes his folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:17
verses.text: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy brings healing.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:18
verses.text: He who ignores discipline comes to poverty and shame, but whoever heeds correction is honored.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:19
verses.text: A longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:20
verses.text: He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:21
verses.text: Misfortune pursues the sinner, but prosperity is the reward of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:22
verses.text: A good man leaves an inheritance for his children's children, but a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:23
verses.text: A poor man's field may produce abundant food, but injustice sweeps it away.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:24
verses.text: He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him is careful to discipline him.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:25
verses.text: The righteous eat to their hearts' content, but the stomach of the wicked goes hungry.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:1
verses.text: The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:2
verses.text: He whose walk is upright fears the LORD, but he whose ways are devious despises him.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:3
verses.text: A fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:4
verses.text: Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but from the strength of an ox comes an abundant harvest.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:5
verses.text: A truthful witness does not deceive, but a false witness pours out lies.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:6
verses.text: The mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:7
verses.text: Stay away from a foolish man, for you will not find knowledge on his lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:8
verses.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to give thought to their ways, but the folly of fools is deception.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:9
verses.text: Fools mock at making amends for sin, but goodwill is found among the upright.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:10
verses.text: Each heart knows its own bitterness, and no one else can share its joy.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:11
verses.text: The house of the wicked will be destroyed, but the tent of the upright will flourish.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:12
verses.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:13
verses.text: Even in laughter the heart may ache, and joy may end in grief.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:14
verses.text: The faithless will be fully repaid for their ways, and the good man rewarded for his.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:15
verses.text: A simple man believes anything, but a prudent man gives thought to his steps.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:16
verses.text: A wise man fears the LORD and shuns evil, but a fool is hotheaded and reckless.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:17
verses.text: A quick-tempered man does foolish things, and a crafty man is hated.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:18
verses.text: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:19
verses.text: Evil men will bow down in the presence of the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:20
verses.text: The poor are shunned even by their neighbors, but the rich have many friends.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:21
verses.text: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who is kind to the needy.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:22
verses.text: Do not those who plot evil go astray? But those who plan what is good find love and faithfulness.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:23
verses.text: All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:24
verses.text: The wealth of the wise is their crown, but the folly of fools yields folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:25
verses.text: A truthful witness saves lives, but a false witness is deceitful.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:26
verses.text: He who fears the LORD has a secure fortress, and for his children it will be a refuge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:27
verses.text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:28
verses.text: A large population is a king's glory, but without subjects a prince is ruined.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:29
verses.text: A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man displays folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:30
verses.text: A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:31
verses.text: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for their Maker, but whoever is kind to the needy honors God.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:32
verses.text: When calamity comes, the wicked are brought down, but even in death the righteous have a refuge.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:33
verses.text: Wisdom reposes in the heart of the discerning and even among fools she lets herself be known.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:34
verses.text: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:35
verses.text: A king delights in a wise servant, but a shameful servant incurs his wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:1
verses.text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:2
verses.text: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:3
verses.text: The eyes of the LORD are everywhere, keeping watch on the wicked and the good.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:4
verses.text: The tongue that brings healing is a tree of life, but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:5
verses.text: A fool spurns his father's discipline, but whoever heeds correction shows prudence.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:6
verses.text: The house of the righteous contains great treasure, but the income of the wicked brings them trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:7
verses.text: The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so the hearts of fools.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:8
verses.text: The LORD detests the sacrifice of the wicked, but the prayer of the upright pleases him.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:9
verses.text: The LORD detests the way of the wicked but he loves those who pursue righteousness.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:10
verses.text: Stern discipline awaits him who leaves the path; he who hates correction will die.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:11
verses.text: Death and Destruction lie open before the LORD - how much more the hearts of men!

verses.name: Proverbs 15:12
verses.text: A mocker resents correction; he will not consult the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:13
verses.text: A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:14
verses.text: The discerning heart seeks knowledge, but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:15
verses.text: All the days of the oppressed are wretched, but the cheerful heart has a continual feast.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:16
verses.text: Better a little with the fear of the LORD than great wealth with turmoil.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:17
verses.text: Better a meal of vegetables where there is love than a fattened calf with hatred.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:18
verses.text: A hot-tempered man stirs up dissension, but a patient man calms a quarrel.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:19
verses.text: The way of the sluggard is blocked with thorns, but the path of the upright is a highway.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:20
verses.text: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish man despises his mother.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:21
verses.text: Folly delights a man who lacks judgment, but a man of understanding keeps a straight course.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:22
verses.text: Plans fail for lack of counsel, but with many advisers they succeed.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:23
verses.text: A man finds joy in giving an apt reply- and how good is a timely word!

verses.name: Proverbs 15:24
verses.text: The path of life leads upward for the wise to keep him from going down to the grave.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:25
verses.text: The LORD tears down the proud man's house but he keeps the widow's boundaries intact.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:26
verses.text: The LORD detests the thoughts of the wicked, but those of the pure are pleasing to him.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:27
verses.text: A greedy man brings trouble to his family, but he who hates bribes will live.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:28
verses.text: The heart of the righteous weighs its answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:29
verses.text: The LORD is far from the wicked but he hears the prayer of the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:30
verses.text: A cheerful look brings joy to the heart, and good news gives health to the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:31
verses.text: He who listens to a life-giving rebuke will be at home among the wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:32
verses.text: He who ignores discipline despises himself, but whoever heeds correction gains understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 15:33
verses.text: The fear of the LORD teaches a man wisdom, and humility comes before honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:1
verses.text: To man belong the plans of the heart, but from the LORD comes the reply of the tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:2
verses.text: All a man's ways seem innocent to him, but motives are weighed by the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:3
verses.text: Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and your plans will succeed.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:4
verses.text: The LORD works out everything for his own ends- even the wicked for a day of disaster.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:5
verses.text: The LORD detests all the proud of heart. Be sure of this: They will not go unpunished.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:6
verses.text: Through love and faithfulness sin is atoned for; through the fear of the LORD a man avoids evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:7
verses.text: When a man's ways are pleasing to the LORD, he makes even his enemies live at peace with him.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:8
verses.text: Better a little with righteousness than much gain with injustice.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:9
verses.text: In his heart a man plans his course, but the LORD determines his steps.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:10
verses.text: The lips of a king speak as an oracle, and his mouth should not betray justice.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:11
verses.text: Honest scales and balances are from the LORD; all the weights in the bag are of his making.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:12
verses.text: Kings detest wrongdoing, for a throne is established through righteousness.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:13
verses.text: Kings take pleasure in honest lips; they value a man who speaks the truth.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:14
verses.text: A king's wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will appease it.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:15
verses.text: When a king's face brightens, it means life; his favor is like a rain cloud in spring.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:16
verses.text: How much better to get wisdom than gold, to choose understanding rather than silver!

verses.name: Proverbs 16:17
verses.text: The highway of the upright avoids evil; he who guards his way guards his life.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:18
verses.text: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:19
verses.text: Better to be lowly in spirit and among the oppressed than to share plunder with the proud.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:20
verses.text: Whoever gives heed to instruction prospers, and blessed is he who trusts in the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:21
verses.text: The wise in heart are called discerning, and pleasant words promote instruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:22
verses.text: Understanding is a fountain of life to those who have it, but folly brings punishment to fools.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:23
verses.text: A wise man's heart guides his mouth, and his lips promote instruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:24
verses.text: Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:25
verses.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:26
verses.text: The laborer's appetite works for him; his hunger drives him on.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:27
verses.text: A scoundrel plots evil, and his speech is like a scorching fire.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:28
verses.text: A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:29
verses.text: A violent man entices his neighbor and leads him down a path that is not good.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:30
verses.text: He who winks with his eye is plotting perversity; he who purses his lips is bent on evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:31
verses.text: Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained by a righteous life.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:32
verses.text: Better a patient man than a warrior, a man who controls his temper than one who takes a city.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:33
verses.text: The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:1
verses.text: Better a dry crust with peace and quiet than a house full of feasting, with strife.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:2
verses.text: A wise servant will rule over a disgraceful son, and will share the inheritance as one of the brothers.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:3
verses.text: The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold, but the LORD tests the heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:4
verses.text: A wicked man listens to evil lips; a liar pays attention to a malicious tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:5
verses.text: He who mocks the poor shows contempt for their Maker; whoever gloats over disaster will not go unpunished.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:6
verses.text: Children's children are a crown to the aged, and parents are the pride of their children.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:7
verses.text: Arrogant lips are unsuited to a fool- how much worse lying lips to a ruler!

verses.name: Proverbs 17:8
verses.text: A bribe is a charm to the one who gives it; wherever he turns, he succeeds.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:9
verses.text: He who covers over an offense promotes love, but whoever repeats the matter separates close friends.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:10
verses.text: A rebuke impresses a man of discernment more than a hundred lashes a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:11
verses.text: An evil man is bent only on rebellion; a merciless official will be sent against him.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:12
verses.text: Better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs than a fool in his folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:13
verses.text: If a man pays back evil for good, evil will never leave his house.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:14
verses.text: Starting a quarrel is like breaching a dam; so drop the matter before a dispute breaks out.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:15
verses.text: Acquitting the guilty and condemning the innocent- the LORD detests them both.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:16
verses.text: Of what use is money in the hand of a fool, since he has no desire to get wisdom?

verses.name: Proverbs 17:17
verses.text: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:18
verses.text: A man lacking in judgment strikes hands in pledge and puts up security for his neighbor.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:19
verses.text: He who loves a quarrel loves sin; he who builds a high gate invites destruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:20
verses.text: A man of perverse heart does not prosper; he whose tongue is deceitful falls into trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:21
verses.text: To have a fool for a son brings grief; there is no joy for the father of a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:22
verses.text: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:23
verses.text: A wicked man accepts a bribe in secret to pervert the course of justice.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:24
verses.text: A discerning man keeps wisdom in view, but a fool's eyes wander to the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:25
verses.text: A foolish son brings grief to his father and bitterness to the one who bore him.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:26
verses.text: It is not good to punish an innocent man, or to flog officials for their integrity.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:27
verses.text: A man of knowledge uses words with restraint, and a man of understanding is even-tempered.

verses.name: Proverbs 17:28
verses.text: Even a fool is thought wise if he keeps silent, and discerning if he holds his tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:1
verses.text: An unfriendly man pursues selfish ends; he defies all sound judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:2
verses.text: A fool finds no pleasure in understanding but delights in airing his own opinions.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:3
verses.text: When wickedness comes, so does contempt, and with shame comes disgrace.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:4
verses.text: The words of a man's mouth are deep waters, but the fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:5
verses.text: It is not good to be partial to the wicked or to deprive the innocent of justice.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:6
verses.text: A fool's lips bring him strife, and his mouth invites a beating.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:7
verses.text: A fool's mouth is his undoing, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:8
verses.text: The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:9
verses.text: One who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:10
verses.text: The name of the LORD is a strong tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:11
verses.text: The wealth of the rich is their fortified city; they imagine it an unscalable wall.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:12
verses.text: Before his downfall a man's heart is proud, but humility comes before honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:13
verses.text: He who answers before listening- that is his folly and his shame.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:14
verses.text: A man's spirit sustains him in sickness, but a crushed spirit who can bear?

verses.name: Proverbs 18:15
verses.text: The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge; the ears of the wise seek it out.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:16
verses.text: A gift opens the way for the giver and ushers him into the presence of the great.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:17
verses.text: The first to present his case seems right, till another comes forward and questions him.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:18
verses.text: Casting the lot settles disputes and keeps strong opponents apart.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:19
verses.text: An offended brother is more unyielding than a fortified city, and disputes are like the barred gates of a citadel.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:20
verses.text: From the fruit of his mouth a man's stomach is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:21
verses.text: The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:22
verses.text: He who finds a wife finds what is good and receives favor from the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:23
verses.text: A poor man pleads for mercy, but a rich man answers harshly.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:24
verses.text: A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:1
verses.text: Better a poor man whose walk is blameless than a fool whose lips are perverse.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:2
verses.text: It is not good to have zeal without knowledge, nor to be hasty and miss the way.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:3
verses.text: A man's own folly ruins his life, yet his heart rages against the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:4
verses.text: Wealth brings many friends, but a poor man's friend deserts him.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:5
verses.text: A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will not go free.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:6
verses.text: Many curry favor with a ruler, and everyone is the friend of a man who gives gifts.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:7
verses.text: A poor man is shunned by all his relatives- how much more do his friends avoid him! Though he pursues them with pleading, they are nowhere to be found.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:8
verses.text: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul; he who cherishes understanding prospers.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:9
verses.text: A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will perish.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:10
verses.text: It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury- how much worse for a slave to rule over princes!

verses.name: Proverbs 19:11
verses.text: A man's wisdom gives him patience; it is to his glory to overlook an offense.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:12
verses.text: A king's rage is like the roar of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:13
verses.text: A foolish son is his father's ruin, and a quarrelsome wife is like a constant dripping.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:14
verses.text: Houses and wealth are inherited from parents, but a prudent wife is from the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:15
verses.text: Laziness brings on deep sleep, and the shiftless man goes hungry.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:16
verses.text: He who obeys instructions guards his life, but he who is contemptuous of his ways will die.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:17
verses.text: He who is kind to the poor lends to the LORD, and he will reward him for what he has done.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:18
verses.text: Discipline your son, for in that there is hope; do not be a willing party to his death.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:19
verses.text: A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty; if you rescue him, you will have to do it again.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:20
verses.text: Listen to advice and accept instruction, and in the end you will be wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:21
verses.text: Many are the plans in a man's heart, but it is the LORD's purpose that prevails.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:22
verses.text: What a man desires is unfailing love; better to be poor than a liar.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:23
verses.text: The fear of the LORD leads to life: Then one rests content, untouched by trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:24
verses.text: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not even bring it back to his mouth!

verses.name: Proverbs 19:25
verses.text: Flog a mocker, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke a discerning man, and he will gain knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:26
verses.text: He who robs his father and drives out his mother is a son who brings shame and disgrace.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:27
verses.text: Stop listening to instruction, my son, and you will stray from the words of knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:28
verses.text: A corrupt witness mocks at justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 19:29
verses.text: Penalties are prepared for mockers, and beatings for the backs of fools.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:1
verses.text: Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler; whoever is led astray by them is not wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:2
verses.text: A king's wrath is like the roar of a lion; he who angers him forfeits his life.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:3
verses.text: It is to a man's honor to avoid strife, but every fool is quick to quarrel.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:4
verses.text: A sluggard does not plow in season; so at harvest time he looks but finds nothing.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:5
verses.text: The purposes of a man's heart are deep waters, but a man of understanding draws them out.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:6
verses.text: Many a man claims to have unfailing love, but a faithful man who can find?

verses.name: Proverbs 20:7
verses.text: The righteous man leads a blameless life; blessed are his children after him.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:8
verses.text: When a king sits on his throne to judge, he winnows out all evil with his eyes.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:9
verses.text: Who can say, "I have kept my heart pure; I am clean and without sin"?

verses.name: Proverbs 20:10
verses.text: Differing weights and differing measures- the LORD detests them both.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:11
verses.text: Even a child is known by his actions, by whether his conduct is pure and right.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:12
verses.text: Ears that hear and eyes that see- the LORD has made them both.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:13
verses.text: Do not love sleep or you will grow poor; stay awake and you will have food to spare.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:14
verses.text: "It's no good, it's no good!" says the buyer; then off he goes and boasts about his purchase.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:15
verses.text: Gold there is, and rubies in abundance, but lips that speak knowledge are a rare jewel.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:16
verses.text: Take the garment of one who puts up security for a stranger; hold it in pledge if he does it for a wayward woman.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:17
verses.text: Food gained by fraud tastes sweet to a man, but he ends up with a mouth full of gravel.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:18
verses.text: Make plans by seeking advice; if you wage war, obtain guidance.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:19
verses.text: A gossip betrays a confidence; so avoid a man who talks too much.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:20
verses.text: If a man curses his father or mother, his lamp will be snuffed out in pitch darkness.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:21
verses.text: An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning will not be blessed at the end.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:22
verses.text: Do not say, "I'll pay you back for this wrong!" Wait for the LORD, and he will deliver you.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:23
verses.text: The LORD detests differing weights, and dishonest scales do not please him.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:24
verses.text: A man's steps are directed by the LORD. How then can anyone understand his own way?

verses.name: Proverbs 20:25
verses.text: It is a trap for a man to dedicate something rashly and only later to consider his vows.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:26
verses.text: A wise king winnows out the wicked; he drives the threshing wheel over them.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:27
verses.text: The lamp of the LORD searches the spirit of a man; it searches out his inmost being.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:28
verses.text: Love and faithfulness keep a king safe; through love his throne is made secure.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:29
verses.text: The glory of young men is their strength, gray hair the splendor of the old.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:30
verses.text: Blows and wounds cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the inmost being.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:1
verses.text: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD; he directs it like a watercourse wherever he pleases.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:2
verses.text: All a man's ways seem right to him, but the LORD weighs the heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:3
verses.text: To do what is right and just is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:4
verses.text: Haughty eyes and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, are sin!

verses.name: Proverbs 21:5
verses.text: The plans of the diligent lead to profit as surely as haste leads to poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:6
verses.text: A fortune made by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor and a deadly snare.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:7
verses.text: The violence of the wicked will drag them away, for they refuse to do what is right.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:8
verses.text: The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:9
verses.text: Better to live on a corner of the roof than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:10
verses.text: The wicked man craves evil; his neighbor gets no mercy from him.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:11
verses.text: When a mocker is punished, the simple gain wisdom; when a wise man is instructed, he gets knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:12
verses.text: The Righteous One takes note of the house of the wicked and brings the wicked to ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:13
verses.text: If a man shuts his ears to the cry of the poor, he too will cry out and not be answered.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:14
verses.text: A gift given in secret soothes anger, and a bribe concealed in the cloak pacifies great wrath.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:15
verses.text: When justice is done, it brings joy to the righteous but terror to evildoers.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:16
verses.text: A man who strays from the path of understanding comes to rest in the company of the dead.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:17
verses.text: He who loves pleasure will become poor; whoever loves wine and oil will never be rich.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:18
verses.text: The wicked become a ransom for the righteous, and the unfaithful for the upright.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:19
verses.text: Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and ill-tempered wife.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:20
verses.text: In the house of the wise are stores of choice food and oil, but a foolish man devours all he has.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:21
verses.text: He who pursues righteousness and love finds life, prosperity and honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:22
verses.text: A wise man attacks the city of the mighty and pulls down the stronghold in which they trust.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:23
verses.text: He who guards his mouth and his tongue keeps himself from calamity.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:24
verses.text: The proud and arrogant man-"Mocker" is his name; he behaves with overweening pride.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:25
verses.text: The sluggard's craving will be the death of him, because his hands refuse to work.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:26
verses.text: All day long he craves for more, but the righteous give without sparing.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:27
verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable- how much more so when brought with evil intent!

verses.name: Proverbs 21:28
verses.text: A false witness will perish, and whoever listens to him will be destroyed forever.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:29
verses.text: A wicked man puts up a bold front, but an upright man gives thought to his ways.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:30
verses.text: There is no wisdom, no insight, no plan that can succeed against the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 21:31
verses.text: The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but victory rests with the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:1
verses.text: A good name is more desirable than great riches; to be esteemed is better than silver or gold.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:2
verses.text: Rich and poor have this in common: The LORD is the Maker of them all.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:3
verses.text: A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:4
verses.text: Humility and the fear of the LORD bring wealth and honor and life.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:5
verses.text: In the paths of the wicked lie thorns and snares, but he who guards his soul stays far from them.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:6
verses.text: Train a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not turn from it.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:7
verses.text: The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:8
verses.text: He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:9
verses.text: A generous man will himself be blessed, for he shares his food with the poor.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:10
verses.text: Drive out the mocker, and out goes strife; quarrels and insults are ended.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:11
verses.text: He who loves a pure heart and whose speech is gracious will have the king for his friend.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:12
verses.text: The eyes of the LORD keep watch over knowledge, but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:13
verses.text: The sluggard says, "There is a lion outside!" or, "I will be murdered in the streets!"

verses.name: Proverbs 22:14
verses.text: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit; he who is under the LORD's wrath will fall into it.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:15
verses.text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:16
verses.text: He who oppresses the poor to increase his wealth and he who gives gifts to the rich-both come to poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:17
verses.text: Pay attention and listen to the sayings of the wise; apply your heart to what I teach,

verses.name: Proverbs 22:18
verses.text: for it is pleasing when you keep them in your heart and have all of them ready on your lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:19
verses.text: So that your trust may be in the LORD, I teach you today, even you.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:20
verses.text: Have I not written thirty sayings for you, sayings of counsel and knowledge,

verses.name: Proverbs 22:21
verses.text: teaching you true and reliable words, so that you can give sound answers to him who sent you?

verses.name: Proverbs 22:22
verses.text: Do not exploit the poor because they are poor and do not crush the needy in court,

verses.name: Proverbs 22:23
verses.text: for the LORD will take up their case and will plunder those who plunder them.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:24
verses.text: Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered,

verses.name: Proverbs 22:25
verses.text: or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:26
verses.text: Do not be a man who strikes hands in pledge or puts up security for debts;

verses.name: Proverbs 22:27
verses.text: if you lack the means to pay, your very bed will be snatched from under you.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:28
verses.text: Do not move an ancient boundary stone set up by your forefathers.

verses.name: Proverbs 22:29
verses.text: Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve before kings; he will not serve before obscure men.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:1
verses.text: When you sit to dine with a ruler, note well what is before you,

verses.name: Proverbs 23:2
verses.text: and put a knife to your throat if you are given to gluttony.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:3
verses.text: Do not crave his delicacies, for that food is deceptive.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:4
verses.text: Do not wear yourself out to get rich; have the wisdom to show restraint.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:5
verses.text: Cast but a glance at riches, and they are gone, for they will surely sprout wings and fly off to the sky like an eagle.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:6
verses.text: Do not eat the food of a stingy man, do not crave his delicacies;

verses.name: Proverbs 23:7
verses.text: for he is the kind of man who is always thinking about the cost. "Eat and drink," he says to you, but his heart is not with you.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:8
verses.text: You will vomit up the little you have eaten and will have wasted your compliments.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:9
verses.text: Do not speak to a fool, for he will scorn the wisdom of your words.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:10
verses.text: Do not move an ancient boundary stone or encroach on the fields of the fatherless,

verses.name: Proverbs 23:11
verses.text: for their Defender is strong; he will take up their case against you.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:12
verses.text: Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:13
verses.text: Do not withhold discipline from a child; if you punish him with the rod, he will not die.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:14
