verses.text: Punish him with the rod and save his soul from death.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:15
verses.text: My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad;

verses.name: Proverbs 23:16
verses.text: my inmost being will rejoice when your lips speak what is right.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:17
verses.text: Do not let your heart envy sinners, but always be zealous for the fear of the LORD.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:18
verses.text: There is surely a future hope for you, and your hope will not be cut off.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:19
verses.text: Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:20
verses.text: Do not join those who drink too much wine or gorge themselves on meat,

verses.name: Proverbs 23:21
verses.text: for drunkards and gluttons become poor, and drowsiness clothes them in rags.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:22
verses.text: Listen to your father, who gave you life, and do not despise your mother when she is old.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:23
verses.text: Buy the truth and do not sell it; get wisdom, discipline and understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:24
verses.text: The father of a righteous man has great joy; he who has a wise son delights in him.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:25
verses.text: May your father and mother be glad; may she who gave you birth rejoice!

verses.name: Proverbs 23:26
verses.text: My son, give me your heart and let your eyes keep to my ways,

verses.name: Proverbs 23:27
verses.text: for a prostitute is a deep pit and a wayward wife is a narrow well.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:28
verses.text: Like a bandit she lies in wait, and multiplies the unfaithful among men.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:29
verses.text: Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?

verses.name: Proverbs 23:30
verses.text: Those who linger over wine, who go to sample bowls of mixed wine.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:31
verses.text: Do not gaze at wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly!

verses.name: Proverbs 23:32
verses.text: In the end it bites like a snake and poisons like a viper.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:33
verses.text: Your eyes will see strange sights and your mind imagine confusing things.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:34
verses.text: You will be like one sleeping on the high seas, lying on top of the rigging.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:35
verses.text: "They hit me," you will say, "but I'm not hurt! They beat me, but I don't feel it! When will I wake up so I can find another drink?"

verses.name: Proverbs 24:1
verses.text: Do not envy wicked men, do not desire their company;

verses.name: Proverbs 24:2
verses.text: for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about making trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:3
verses.text: By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established;

verses.name: Proverbs 24:4
verses.text: through knowledge its rooms are filled with rare and beautiful treasures.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:5
verses.text: A wise man has great power, and a man of knowledge increases strength;

verses.name: Proverbs 24:6
verses.text: for waging war you need guidance, and for victory many advisers.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:7
verses.text: Wisdom is too high for a fool; in the assembly at the gate he has nothing to say.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:8
verses.text: He who plots evil will be known as a schemer.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:9
verses.text: The schemes of folly are sin, and men detest a mocker.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:10
verses.text: If you falter in times of trouble, how small is your strength!

verses.name: Proverbs 24:11
verses.text: Rescue those being led away to death; hold back those staggering toward slaughter.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:12
verses.text: If you say, "But we knew nothing about this," does not he who weighs the heart perceive it? Does not he who guards your life know it? Will he not repay each person according to what he has done?

verses.name: Proverbs 24:13
verses.text: Eat honey, my son, for it is good; honey from the comb is sweet to your taste.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:14
verses.text: Know also that wisdom is sweet to your soul; if you find it, there is a future hope for you, and your hope will not be cut off.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:15
verses.text: Do not lie in wait like an outlaw against a righteous man's house, do not raid his dwelling place;

verses.name: Proverbs 24:16
verses.text: for though a righteous man falls seven times, he rises again, but the wicked are brought down by calamity.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:17
verses.text: Do not gloat when your enemy falls; when he stumbles, do not let your heart rejoice,

verses.name: Proverbs 24:18
verses.text: or the LORD will see and disapprove and turn his wrath away from him.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:19
verses.text: Do not fret because of evil men or be envious of the wicked,

verses.name: Proverbs 24:20
verses.text: for the evil man has no future hope, and the lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:21
verses.text: Fear the LORD and the king, my son, and do not join with the rebellious,

verses.name: Proverbs 24:22
verses.text: for those two will send sudden destruction upon them, and who knows what calamities they can bring? Further Sayings of the Wise

verses.name: Proverbs 24:23
verses.text: These also are sayings of the wise: To show partiality in judging is not good:

verses.name: Proverbs 24:24
verses.text: Whoever says to the guilty, "You are innocent"- peoples will curse him and nations denounce him.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:25
verses.text: But it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and rich blessing will come upon them.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:26
verses.text: An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:27
verses.text: Finish your outdoor work and get your fields ready; after that, build your house.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:28
verses.text: Do not testify against your neighbor without cause, or use your lips to deceive.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:29
verses.text: Do not say, "I'll do to him as he has done to me; I'll pay that man back for what he did."

verses.name: Proverbs 24:30
verses.text: I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment;

verses.name: Proverbs 24:31
verses.text: thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins.

verses.name: Proverbs 24:32
verses.text: I applied my heart to what I observed and learned a lesson from what I saw:

verses.name: Proverbs 24:33
verses.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest-

verses.name: Proverbs 24:34
verses.text: and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:1
verses.text: These are more proverbs of Solomon, copied by the men of Hezekiah king of Judah:

verses.name: Proverbs 25:2
verses.text: It is the glory of God to conceal a matter; to search out a matter is the glory of kings.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:3
verses.text: As the heavens are high and the earth is deep, so the hearts of kings are unsearchable.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:4
verses.text: Remove the dross from the silver, and out comes material for the silversmith;

verses.name: Proverbs 25:5
verses.text: remove the wicked from the king's presence, and his throne will be established through righteousness.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:6
verses.text: Do not exalt yourself in the king's presence, and do not claim a place among great men;

verses.name: Proverbs 25:7
verses.text: it is better for him to say to you, "Come up here," than for him to humiliate you before a nobleman. What you have seen with your eyes

verses.name: Proverbs 25:8
verses.text: do not bring hastily to court, for what will you do in the end if your neighbor puts you to shame?

verses.name: Proverbs 25:9
verses.text: If you argue your case with a neighbor, do not betray another man's confidence,

verses.name: Proverbs 25:10
verses.text: or he who hears it may shame you and you will never lose your bad reputation.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:11
verses.text: A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:12
verses.text: Like an earring of gold or an ornament of fine gold is a wise man's rebuke to a listening ear.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:13
verses.text: Like the coolness of snow at harvest time is a trustworthy messenger to those who send him; he refreshes the spirit of his masters.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:14
verses.text: Like clouds and wind without rain is a man who boasts of gifts he does not give.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:15
verses.text: Through patience a ruler can be persuaded, and a gentle tongue can break a bone.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:16
verses.text: If you find honey, eat just enough- too much of it, and you will vomit.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:17
verses.text: Seldom set foot in your neighbor's house- too much of you, and he will hate you.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:18
verses.text: Like a club or a sword or a sharp arrow is the man who gives false testimony against his neighbor.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:19
verses.text: Like a bad tooth or a lame foot is reliance on the unfaithful in times of trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:20
verses.text: Like one who takes away a garment on a cold day, or like vinegar poured on soda, is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:21
verses.text: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:22
verses.text: In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head, and the LORD will reward you.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:23
verses.text: As a north wind brings rain, so a sly tongue brings angry looks.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:24
verses.text: Better to live on a corner of the roof than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:25
verses.text: Like cold water to a weary soul is good news from a distant land.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:26
verses.text: Like a muddied spring or a polluted well is a righteous man who gives way to the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:27
verses.text: It is not good to eat too much honey, nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 25:28
verses.text: Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self-control.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:1
verses.text: Like snow in summer or rain in harvest, honor is not fitting for a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:2
verses.text: Like a fluttering sparrow or a darting swallow, an undeserved curse does not come to rest.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:3
verses.text: A whip for the horse, a halter for the donkey, and a rod for the backs of fools!

verses.name: Proverbs 26:4
verses.text: Do not answer a fool according to his folly, or you will be like him yourself.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:5
verses.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, or he will be wise in his own eyes.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:6
verses.text: Like cutting off one's feet or drinking violence is the sending of a message by the hand of a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:7
verses.text: Like a lame man's legs that hang limp is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:8
verses.text: Like tying a stone in a sling is the giving of honor to a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:9
verses.text: Like a thornbush in a drunkard's hand is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:10
verses.text: Like an archer who wounds at random is he who hires a fool or any passer-by.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:11
verses.text: As a dog returns to its vomit, so a fool repeats his folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:12
verses.text: Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:13
verses.text: The sluggard says, "There is a lion in the road, a fierce lion roaming the streets!"

verses.name: Proverbs 26:14
verses.text: As a door turns on its hinges, so a sluggard turns on his bed.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:15
verses.text: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:16
verses.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer discreetly.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:17
verses.text: Like one who seizes a dog by the ears is a passer-by who meddles in a quarrel not his own.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:18
verses.text: Like a madman shooting firebrands or deadly arrows

verses.name: Proverbs 26:19
verses.text: is a man who deceives his neighbor and says, "I was only joking!"

verses.name: Proverbs 26:20
verses.text: Without wood a fire goes out; without gossip a quarrel dies down.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:21
verses.text: As charcoal to embers and as wood to fire, so is a quarrelsome man for kindling strife.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:22
verses.text: The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:23
verses.text: Like a coating of glaze over earthenware are fervent lips with an evil heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:24
verses.text: A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, but in his heart he harbors deceit.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:25
verses.text: Though his speech is charming, do not believe him, for seven abominations fill his heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:26
verses.text: His malice may be concealed by deception, but his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:27
verses.text: If a man digs a pit, he will fall into it; if a man rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.

verses.name: Proverbs 26:28
verses.text: A lying tongue hates those it hurts, and a flattering mouth works ruin.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:1
verses.text: Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring forth.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:2
verses.text: Let another praise you, and not your own mouth; someone else, and not your own lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:3
verses.text: Stone is heavy and sand a burden, but provocation by a fool is heavier than both.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:4
verses.text: Anger is cruel and fury overwhelming, but who can stand before jealousy?

verses.name: Proverbs 27:5
verses.text: Better is open rebuke than hidden love.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:6
verses.text: Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:7
verses.text: He who is full loathes honey, but to the hungry even what is bitter tastes sweet.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:8
verses.text: Like a bird that strays from its nest is a man who strays from his home.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:9
verses.text: Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart, and the pleasantness of one's friend springs from his earnest counsel.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:10
verses.text: Do not forsake your friend and the friend of your father, and do not go to your brother's house when disaster strikes you- better a neighbor nearby than a brother far away.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:11
verses.text: Be wise, my son, and bring joy to my heart; then I can answer anyone who treats me with contempt.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:12
verses.text: The prudent see danger and take refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:13
verses.text: Take the garment of one who puts up security for a stranger; hold it in pledge if he does it for a wayward woman.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:14
verses.text: If a man loudly blesses his neighbor early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:15
verses.text: A quarrelsome wife is like a constant dripping on a rainy day;

verses.name: Proverbs 27:16
verses.text: restraining her is like restraining the wind or grasping oil with the hand.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:17
verses.text: As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:18
verses.text: He who tends a fig tree will eat its fruit, and he who looks after his master will be honored.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:19
verses.text: As water reflects a face, so a man's heart reflects the man.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:20
verses.text: Death and Destruction are never satisfied, and neither are the eyes of man.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:21
verses.text: The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold, but man is tested by the praise he receives.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:22
verses.text: Though you grind a fool in a mortar, grinding him like grain with a pestle, you will not remove his folly from him.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:23
verses.text: Be sure you know the condition of your flocks, give careful attention to your herds;

verses.name: Proverbs 27:24
verses.text: for riches do not endure forever, and a crown is not secure for all generations.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:25
verses.text: When the hay is removed and new growth appears and the grass from the hills is gathered in,

verses.name: Proverbs 27:26
verses.text: the lambs will provide you with clothing, and the goats with the price of a field.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:27
verses.text: You will have plenty of goats' milk to feed you and your family and to nourish your servant girls.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:1
verses.text: The wicked man flees though no one pursues, but the righteous are as bold as a lion.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:2
verses.text: When a country is rebellious, it has many rulers, but a man of understanding and knowledge maintains order.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:3
verses.text: A ruler who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain that leaves no crops.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:4
verses.text: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law resist them.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:5
verses.text: Evil men do not understand justice, but those who seek the LORD understand it fully.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:6
verses.text: Better a poor man whose walk is blameless than a rich man whose ways are perverse.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:7
verses.text: He who keeps the law is a discerning son, but a companion of gluttons disgraces his father.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:8
verses.text: He who increases his wealth by exorbitant interest amasses it for another, who will be kind to the poor.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:9
verses.text: If anyone turns a deaf ear to the law, even his prayers are detestable.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:10
verses.text: He who leads the upright along an evil path will fall into his own trap, but the blameless will receive a good inheritance.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:11
verses.text: A rich man may be wise in his own eyes, but a poor man who has discernment sees through him.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:12
verses.text: When the righteous triumph, there is great elation; but when the wicked rise to power, men go into hiding.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:13
verses.text: He who conceals his sins does not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:14
verses.text: Blessed is the man who always fears the LORD, but he who hardens his heart falls into trouble.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:15
verses.text: Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked man ruling over a helpless people.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:16
verses.text: A tyrannical ruler lacks judgment, but he who hates ill-gotten gain will enjoy a long life.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:17
verses.text: A man tormented by the guilt of murder will be a fugitive till death; let no one support him.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:18
verses.text: He whose walk is blameless is kept safe, but he whose ways are perverse will suddenly fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:19
verses.text: He who works his land will have abundant food, but the one who chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:20
verses.text: A faithful man will be richly blessed, but one eager to get rich will not go unpunished.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:21
verses.text: To show partiality is not good- yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:22
verses.text: A stingy man is eager to get rich and is unaware that poverty awaits him.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:23
verses.text: He who rebukes a man will in the end gain more favor than he who has a flattering tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:24
verses.text: He who robs his father or mother and says, "It's not wrong"- he is partner to him who destroys.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:25
verses.text: A greedy man stirs up dissension, but he who trusts in the LORD will prosper.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:26
verses.text: He who trusts in himself is a fool, but he who walks in wisdom is kept safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:27
verses.text: He who gives to the poor will lack nothing, but he who closes his eyes to them receives many curses.

verses.name: Proverbs 28:28
verses.text: When the wicked rise to power, people go into hiding; but when the wicked perish, the righteous thrive.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:1
verses.text: A man who remains stiff-necked after many rebukes will suddenly be destroyed-without remedy.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:2
verses.text: When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; when the wicked rule, the people groan.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:3
verses.text: A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:4
verses.text: By justice a king gives a country stability, but one who is greedy for bribes tears it down.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:5
verses.text: Whoever flatters his neighbor is spreading a net for his feet.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:6
verses.text: An evil man is snared by his own sin, but a righteous one can sing and be glad.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:7
verses.text: The righteous care about justice for the poor, but the wicked have no such concern.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:8
verses.text: Mockers stir up a city, but wise men turn away anger.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:9
verses.text: If a wise man goes to court with a fool, the fool rages and scoffs, and there is no peace.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:10
verses.text: Bloodthirsty men hate a man of integrity and seek to kill the upright.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:11
verses.text: A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:12
verses.text: If a ruler listens to lies, all his officials become wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:13
verses.text: The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: The LORD gives sight to the eyes of both.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:14
verses.text: If a king judges the poor with fairness, his throne will always be secure.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:15
verses.text: The rod of correction imparts wisdom, but a child left to himself disgraces his mother.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:16
verses.text: When the wicked thrive, so does sin, but the righteous will see their downfall.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:17
verses.text: Discipline your son, and he will give you peace; he will bring delight to your soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:18
verses.text: Where there is no revelation, the people cast off restraint; but blessed is he who keeps the law.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:19
verses.text: A servant cannot be corrected by mere words; though he understands, he will not respond.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:20
verses.text: Do you see a man who speaks in haste? There is more hope for a fool than for him.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:21
verses.text: If a man pampers his servant from youth, he will bring grief in the end.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:22
verses.text: An angry man stirs up dissension, and a hot-tempered one commits many sins.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:23
verses.text: A man's pride brings him low, but a man of lowly spirit gains honor.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:24
verses.text: The accomplice of a thief is his own enemy; he is put under oath and dare not testify.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:25
verses.text: Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the LORD is kept safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:26
verses.text: Many seek an audience with a ruler, but it is from the LORD that man gets justice.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:27
verses.text: The righteous detest the dishonest; the wicked detest the upright.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:1
verses.text: The sayings of Agur son of Jakeh-an oracle: This man declared to Ithiel, to Ithiel and to Ucal:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:2
verses.text: "I am the most ignorant of men; I do not have a man's understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:3
verses.text: I have not learned wisdom, nor have I knowledge of the Holy One.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:4
verses.text: Who has gone up to heaven and come down? Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hands? Who has wrapped up the waters in his cloak? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and the name of his son? Tell me if you know!

verses.name: Proverbs 30:5
verses.text: "Every word of God is flawless; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:6
verses.text: Do not add to his words, or he will rebuke you and prove you a liar.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:7
verses.text: "Two things I ask of you, O LORD; do not refuse me before I die:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:8
verses.text: Keep falsehood and lies far from me; give me neither poverty nor riches, but give me only my daily bread.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:9
verses.text: Otherwise, I may have too much and disown you and say, 'Who is the LORD?' Or I may become poor and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:10
verses.text: "Do not slander a servant to his master, or he will curse you, and you will pay for it.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:11
verses.text: "There are those who curse their fathers and do not bless their mothers;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:12
verses.text: those who are pure in their own eyes and yet are not cleansed of their filth;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:13
verses.text: those whose eyes are ever so haughty, whose glances are so disdainful;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:14
verses.text: those whose teeth are swords and whose jaws are set with knives to devour the poor from the earth, the needy from among mankind.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:15
verses.text: "The leech has two daughters. 'Give! Give!' they cry. "There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, 'Enough!':

verses.name: Proverbs 30:16
verses.text: the grave, the barren womb, land, which is never satisfied with water, and fire, which never says, 'Enough!'

verses.name: Proverbs 30:17
verses.text: "The eye that mocks a father, that scorns obedience to a mother, will be pecked out by the ravens of the valley, will be eaten by the vultures.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:18
verses.text: "There are three things that are too amazing for me, four that I do not understand:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:19
verses.text: the way of an eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship on the high seas, and the way of a man with a maiden.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:20
verses.text: "This is the way of an adulteress: She eats and wipes her mouth and says, 'I've done nothing wrong.'

verses.name: Proverbs 30:21
verses.text: "Under three things the earth trembles, under four it cannot bear up:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:22
verses.text: a servant who becomes king, a fool who is full of food,

verses.name: Proverbs 30:23
verses.text: an unloved woman who is married, and a maidservant who displaces her mistress.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:24
verses.text: "Four things on earth are small, yet they are extremely wise:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:25
verses.text: Ants are creatures of little strength, yet they store up their food in the summer;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:26
verses.text: coneys are creatures of little power, yet they make their home in the crags;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:27
verses.text: locusts have no king, yet they advance together in ranks;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:28
verses.text: a lizard can be caught with the hand, yet it is found in kings' palaces.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:29
verses.text: "There are three things that are stately in their stride, four that move with stately bearing:

verses.name: Proverbs 30:30
verses.text: a lion, mighty among beasts, who retreats before nothing;

verses.name: Proverbs 30:31
verses.text: a strutting rooster, a he-goat, and a king with his army around him.

verses.name: Proverbs 30:32
verses.text: "If you have played the fool and exalted yourself, or if you have planned evil, clap your hand over your mouth!

verses.name: Proverbs 30:33
verses.text: For as churning the milk produces butter, and as twisting the nose produces blood, so stirring up anger produces strife."

verses.name: Proverbs 31:1
verses.text: The sayings of King Lemuel-an oracle his mother taught him:

verses.name: Proverbs 31:2
verses.text: "O my son, O son of my womb, O son of my vows,

verses.name: Proverbs 31:3
verses.text: do not spend your strength on women, your vigor on those who ruin kings.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:4
verses.text: "It is not for kings, O Lemuel- not for kings to drink wine, not for rulers to crave beer,

verses.name: Proverbs 31:5
verses.text: lest they drink and forget what the law decrees, and deprive all the oppressed of their rights.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:6
verses.text: Give beer to those who are perishing, wine to those who are in anguish;

verses.name: Proverbs 31:7
verses.text: let them drink and forget their poverty and remember their misery no more.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:8
verses.text: "Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves, for the rights of all who are destitute.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:9
verses.text: Speak up and judge fairly; defend the rights of the poor and needy." Epilogue: The Wife of Noble Character

verses.name: Proverbs 31:10
verses.text: A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:11
verses.text: Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:12
verses.text: She brings him good, not harm, all the days of her life.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:13
verses.text: She selects wool and flax and works with eager hands.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:14
verses.text: She is like the merchant ships, bringing her food from afar.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:15
verses.text: She gets up while it is still dark; she provides food for her family and portions for her servant girls.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:16
verses.text: She considers a field and buys it; out of her earnings she plants a vineyard.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:17
verses.text: She sets about her work vigorously; her arms are strong for her tasks.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:18
verses.text: She sees that her trading is profitable, and her lamp does not go out at night.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:19
verses.text: In her hand she holds the distaff and grasps the spindle with her fingers.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:20
verses.text: She opens her arms to the poor and extends her hands to the needy.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:21
verses.text: When it snows, she has no fear for her household; for all of them are clothed in scarlet.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:22
verses.text: She makes coverings for her bed; she is clothed in fine linen and purple.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:23
verses.text: Her husband is respected at the city gate, where he takes his seat among the elders of the land.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:24
verses.text: She makes linen garments and sells them, and supplies the merchants with sashes.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:25
verses.text: She is clothed with strength and dignity; she can laugh at the days to come.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:26
verses.text: She speaks with wisdom, and faithful instruction is on her tongue.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:27
verses.text: She watches over the affairs of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:28
verses.text: Her children arise and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her:

verses.name: Proverbs 31:29
verses.text: "Many women do noble things, but you surpass them all."

verses.name: Proverbs 31:30
verses.text: Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised.

verses.name: Proverbs 31:31
verses.text: Give her the reward she has earned, and let her works bring her praise at the city gate.
